category: Aromatic Substances that Open the Orifices

action.primary: Opens the Orifices, resolves Phlegm and awakens the Spirit

indications: Wind-Stroke and Phlegm Collapse or Qi Stagnation with sudden collapse, delirium or coma and a stifling sensation and focal distention in the chest and abdomen due to Phlegm Obstructing the Orifices

action.primary: Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain

indications: Chest and abdominal pain due to Qi and Blood Stagnation

action.primary: Promotes the movement of Qi and Blood, unblocks the channels and collaterals and alleviates pain

indications: Wind-Cold-Damp Bi with muscle aches, joint pain and difficulty moving

contraindications: Use caution for those with Yin Deficiency Fire.
Use caution for those with Excess Fire.
Use caution for those with Qi Deficiency.

useCases: Wind-Stroke from Damp-Cold and turbid Phlegm
Phlegm-Dampness that has transformed into Heat
Intense Liver Qi Stagnation which seriously disrupts the qi and leads to sudden loss of consciousness
Abdominal pain in children due to Cold in which the legs are drawn up and the child cries
Sudden turmoil disorder due to Cold-Damp
Postpartum coma due to stagnant Blood and clenched jaw while sinking toward death

notes: This herb can be used by itself as a powder placed in boiling water for pain.
Some sources say that this herb can eliminate bad odor.

Both An Xi Xiang and Styrax #{SuHeXiang} Su He Xiang open orifices and treat loss of consciousness An Xi Xiang is similar in strength to Su He Xiang, but is not as warm, however it invigorates Blood, and is used to treat chest and abdominal pain and postpartum coma. Su He Xiang transforms Phlegm and clears away filth for Wind-Stroke and collapse due to Phlegm.
